cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 285 mi east of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then turning west toward the south-central Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central and upper Texas coast; minor impacts possible along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts below tropical-storm force are possible, but sustained 34-kt winds are unlikely (≤3% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises and hazardous surf/rip currents along the southeast Louisiana coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain Friday into Saturday could total 3–5 inches, locally higher, producing localized street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents for coastal and bar-pilot operations.
